headline: Federal Employee
summary: An employee with the Department of Homeland Security, and Military Veteran with over 7 years of proven experience in the United States Marine Corps.  Accomplished measurable results while leading in a dynamic, fast - paced environment.  Possess a comprehensive background in asset management, procurement, and accountability derived from conducting domestic and global operations in Iraq and Afghanistan.  Managed risk upon multiple lines to protect assets, property, and equipment valued over $300M while meeting the expectations of senior leadership.  Possess general knowledge in financial data and budgetary analysis.  Recipient of multiple awards for outstanding performance and professionalism.  Career supported by a Bachelorâs Degree in Economics from California State University Northridge.

defaultPosition.description:
- Research detainee history using multiple sources to establish identity/citizenship and manage detained and non-detained dockets.
- Provide administrative support to managers, supervisors, or staff members by assisting in the day-to-day management of the office's activities.
- Summarize and tabulate detainee information from various reports, utilizing a variety of databases and automated systems.
- Generate and verify detainee reports, encounters, charging documents, studies, data quality and create and revise spreadsheets, charts, graphs, and presentations.
- Exercising quality control over bond paperwork.
defaultPosition.title: Enforcement and Removal Assistant

positions.description:
- Research detainee history using multiple sources to establish identity/citizenship and manage detained and non-detained dockets.
- Provide administrative support to managers, supervisors, or staff members by assisting in the day-to-day management of the office's activities.
- Summarize and tabulate detainee information from various reports, utilizing a variety of databases and automated systems.
- Generate and verify detainee reports, encounters, charging documents, studies, data quality and create and revise spreadsheets, charts, graphs, and presentations.
- Exercising quality control over bond paperwork.
positions.title: Enforcement and Removal Assistant

positions.description:
- Assisted the Los Angeles Enforcement and Removal Operations, Mission Support Unit, Property Manager with maintaining equipment in support of removal operations.
- Performed functions on Sunflower Asset Management Solutions (SAMS) software dealing with the user, location, and status of property.
- Processed serialized property for distribution to second hand users and electronic recycling companies.
- Prepared procurement reports, ordered and delivered supplies for the Los Angeles Field Office.
- Trouble shot various technical problems on information systems.
positions.title: Student Trainee

positions.description:
- Maintained accountability and security of sensitive devices valued over $5.3M; maintained accountability and security of sensitive and classified information.
- Designed, planned, and conducted professional training to a team of over 15 personnel regarding the procedures, documentation, and usage of sensitive equipment to ensure a high level of mission readiness in support of up to 800 employees.
- Created performance work plans for junior employees; counseled subordinates on job performance and disciplinary issues.
- Scheduled and coordinated maintenance efforts for 530 pieces of radio equipment; supervised the maintenance of communication equipment in assigned vehicles valued over $5.3M.
- Fulfilled communication equipment requests to support up to 800 personnel.
positions.title: Electronic Key Management System Supervisor & Radio Supervisor

positions.description:
- Scheduled and coordinated maintenance efforts for 250 pieces of radio equipment; supervised the maintenance of communication equipment in 20 assigned vehicles valued over $300M.
- Conducted staff training exercises for 180 personnel on 10 separate communication systems and reporting procedures to ensure a high level of mission readiness.
- Created performance work plans for junior employees; counseled subordinates on job performance and disciplinary issues.
- Communicated and coordinated logistic requests, medical evacuations, combat reports, and support requirements for a company of 180 personnel.
- Managed and protected classified data.
positions.title: Company Communications Chief

positions.description:
- Planned, organized, and prepared equipment procurement reports to order equipment and supplies for senior leadership; ensured adherence to assigned supply budget and logistical restrictions.
- Planned, organized, and prepared radio communications equipment for logistic transport to be used in support of over 15,000 employees in a combat environment.
- Maintained accountability, records, coordinated repairs, and ordered replacement parts for radio communications equipment.
- Created performance work plans for junior employees; counseled subordinates on job performance and disciplinary issues.
- Served as a Senior Radio Operator in a Combat Operations Center, sending and receiving combat reports, coordinating medical evacuation requests, and handling other various administrative reports.
positions.title: Radio Supervisor

positions.description:
- Maintained an inventory of over 500 end-items of radio communications equipment; maintained records, coordinated repairs, and ordered replacement parts.
- Planned, organized, and prepared equipment procurement reports to order equipment and supplies for senior leadership; ensured adherence to assigned supply budget and logistical restrictions
- Created performance work plans for junior employees; counseled subordinates on job performance and disciplinary issues.
- Setup and maintained all radio communication networks and provided direct communication support for platoon and company level commanders.
- Safely transported detainees from United States Military detention centers to local foreign police departments.
positions.title: Field Radio Operator
